I strongly agree.I often tried to make my worlds survival only but i always failed because of this open to lan button.
If you accidentally start a world in hardcore without cheats and have to go to lab every time to change it to survival, this would be very helpful
I agree i always have a hard time staying in survival but i really want to do a real survival gameplay but i just always end up going into creative and its hard to stop
Perhaps it could be a curse, like binding or vanishing, with the effect that you described but with the added drawback of decreased movement speed
I agree, and maybe if it´s incompatible with depth strider, or thorns, it could be balanced.
Maybe could also counteract, at least partly, the levitation effect from shulkers.
This sounds like netherite...
Enchantment only for boots?

Take in consideration that each small oak tree has about 51 blocks of leaves so the probability gets higher for at least one enchanted apple. Plus it takes away from the incentive to explore since tree farms would be the better way to get them.
I like it but enchanted golden apples are too powerful
I agree that enchanted apples are much too powerful. I am editing this post to remove that part.

Yes, leggings need more exclusive enchantments; make them more useful.

It also seems more logical for depth strider on legs, because those are what power the player speed underwater, not the feet.

I fully agree with this. This would allow a new and a more fresh experience when it comes to creative building and progression in survival mode. Maybe in the future this can even extend with the smithing table being able to add additions to your gear such as a longer blade to your sword, or maybe some cool looking spikes on your shoulder pads. It would honestly make the game so much more interesting in how new items and features are presented. Great suggestion!

I agree with this, and i have another idea (for bedrock edition)
In Java Edition, if you hold shift while Crafting, you get the maximum of one item that you can get with your actual number ingredients.
That would be cool in Bedrock Edition, but instead if we hold the Craft button, we'll get the items for how much we hold it, instead of clicking to craft every item.
how about if you put an item behind or on side of it, you will unlock repices.(like if you put a stonecutter near it, you can craft those item without using them.)
only on hard difficulty
The difficulty of your game would make the time longer, and the only way to get ride of the effect would be to kill the Phantom that attacked you
This insomnia feature is already useless and frustrating, why make it worst ?

you may be thinking that honey isn't a useful food since it's supposed to fill up saturation (in other words, increase health regen) more than it fills up hunger, but I do still agree that honey should make health boost potions. Perhaps netherwart brewed into honey could give you an awkward honey, and from there a glistering melon is used to make health boost potions.
Maybe brewing netherwart into honey bottles? and instead of health boost, the effect should be absorbtion, because health boost is too op and absorbtion 4 might be a good idea.

At least make make honey bottles less of a worthless food source. Even cooked cod is a more effective food in terms of saturation. 
I see some confusion around the internet about their viability as a food source. I just want to clear something up: Originally honey was equivalent to cooked salmon restoring 6 hunger points (points, NOT bars) and 9.6 saturation (saturation will indirectly effect how much your health can regen but is NOT a health regen stat). That would have been a very nice food source. With honey bottles saturation nerfed to a measly 2.4 they are now a fairly worthless food source more in line with apples or chorus fruit.
Buff saturation back to 9.6 and I will start farming and carrying honey bottles. Also, for me, the poison nullification effect isn't enough to justify a precious inventory slot. Make it cure the wither effect. Or maybe instead of just curing poison (or wither?) it could also give resistance? I really like the health boost idea in the suggestion. Maybe it would be similar to the absorption effect from golden/notch apples? Honey bottles have a lot of potential as a food source but are largely untapped as of now. Let's do something about that!

I hope this is a given, as Minecraft’s lore comes secondary to gameplay, adding lore might hinder additions to the game in the future: if they speak of creatures of the past that went extinct, we would be unable to add said creatures into the game. With a Minecraft movie cresting the horizon I hope the producers and screenwriters capture the essence of the game rather than explaining it.

As animal as lore comes secondary, however making 'no lord's a rule can also be a problem, you don't want a situation where you countdicing yourself left and right, you want there to seem like there is a solution that makes sense, if there isn't actually one even if it's permanently hidden that can be very difficult if there just winging it.

I agree with you, game theories are the most fun things you can do in a game... Admitted that the game has an actual lore. I don't think Mojang has ever created a lore for the game, and this is the real issue: not knowing wether there is a story that makes sense or just random content put together can make lore theories really frustrating, and take the fun away. I think Mojang should build a lore and then just announce that it exists, without spoiling it, so that people can have fun guessing while knowing there are actual logical connections between all the content pieces in the game. As far as we know, they could already have a lore in mind since the beta versions of the game, but the lack of certainties is what ruins the speculation.

I agree and disagree. I feel like right now some of the newer things they’ve added I’d like some hints on what went down. I don’t want it all spelled out but I would like to be able to go on a “quest” to find it if I pleased. Sometimes have a lore less world makes it feel so empty, like it’s not even alive, it’s just a toy. I think having a story about how the Ender dragon appeared or literally anything on the Wither especially (since it’s completely out of nowhere) or why these things are an issue when they are so hard to come by at all would be nice to know
There is already lore in the game, HOWEVER, that does not hinder creativity, as any given player can override that lore in their own creations.
Minecraft legends exist this person nope nope shut stop adding lore
Command blocks are already in those versions, you just need creative and the command using options then use the give command to give yourself a command block
i like that idea but it should be for ps4 also

I think it’s a great idea maybe a mod but not on vanilla and hear me out. Vanilla Minecraft is more Stone Age or not really modern they probably are not gonna add security cameras because it’s kinda too op or modern. You don’t have to believe me that’s just my opinion.
+1, there should be honey advancements.
ya  like jazz?

I think you would really enjoy a mod called Terrafirmacraft, which is an older mod that's compatible with 1.8 (?). Ethoslab did a series on it, and it has some very challenging combat mechanics, simply because mobs are really strong.

These all sound like mod features that break the feel of the game, not making it hard, just more tedious :/
2/5 stars, needs a lot of work

While I do agree there should be a separate harder mode for minecraft survival I wouldn't want them to stray too far away from the original material.

 

I'd love a stupid ton of zombies spawning all of the time as one example.

"It also makes the mobs become a lot more harder to kill and slowly faster every in-game day. With the new moon event suggestion, you can possibly add some kind of challenge to it as well."

I like this, this concept makes the game more playable and challenging during endgame(where I usually get bored and go do something else), although I think there should be a limit to this growth since we, the players ourselves are capped (at the most recent update) to fully enchanted netherite. I feel like this idea should be implemented, with a toggle switch of course, (this also somewhat solves the problem of asking and getting lots of stuff for doing nothing)

idk I like the idea though
very good idea
It's great i think it can be combined with magic update and industrial update the ancient crafts can bring a mega update and make minecraft the best game of the year more than one time
Hmm. Not a bad Idea. I personally think it's a tad bit complicated, but the lore stuff is a nice touch. (I like the fairy tale. That's really cute.)
Oh also the healing witch can't heal the zombies as they're burned by healing potions, but if she used harming she could hurt the pillagers with her area of effect.
solid. voted.
Hay already reduces fall damage so this should defiantly be a thing. Maybe the depth of the snow determines how much damage it reduces.
Diego guadalupe Espinoza Posada
Topic clarified to reflect post contents.
Yes. I miss old Minecraft where fog was a huge factor in gameplay. Less fog=more visibility and less adventure.

Yes we need a way to revert certain chunks so we have a way to "respawn" or "rediscover" newly designed chunks as they come out with new versions. IE: If you have explored 9000x9000 blocks specifically to make a huge map wall, the ultimate disappointment ensues when a new update like Pillagers comes out and you can't find any within weeks of travel from your home.

Good idea. I agree with the pillager Outpost idea, and it could be added to mansions as well. The only thing is: Banners are mostly decorative in my opinion, however a new type of banner or adding this functionality to an existing banner color could be added. Why not a Peace banner or banner pattern that when applied disables mobs in a radius? Also, why not use peaceful difficulty?

Much too OP in my opinion. Just 6 blocks of wool and a stick and you can essentially do the work of several torches. This would especially be the case if the feature was on by default. Maybe this would be better suited as a gamerule or something? Idk I feel like this all should just be left to plugins.
Land claim would be useful for public realms or servers using the official bedrock server software.

I like the ideas of stopping mob spawning and the protection of area from other players. However, personally the absolute protection from damage caused by other players is over powered. Maybe instead of completely stopping outside players from destroying any block, Mining Fatigue III could be applied, making their block destruction quite slow. This would give the owners of the protected areas a chance to defend their land, but also gives concepts like castle sieges a possibility, instead of letting attackers cut through a stone wall instantly with a diamond pickaxe. Probably all types of block placing by outsiders should be prohibited because just a bucket of water or lava could do all sorts of damage.

In addition, preventing (quick) block destruction could permit people to make redstone gate and combination mechanisms, actually encouraging the visitors to determine the key or code to enter instead of mining their way through the door.

Cool idea! This would definitely add some atmosphere.

Another thing that I've found kind of ugly about TNT is the explosion itself - I feel like it'd be much nicer-looking if, instead of using tons of medium-sized particles, the explosion was one big particle. In theory, this might reduce lag from large explosions, as well.
LOL, pore mumbo

I like Refraction. I love Spectral, but tht's already a name for a potion effect. Phaser sounds like something that would apply to all blocks. Prismatic sounds like it would split you into all the different colours of the yadda yadda yadda and kill you. Glass-Pass sounds like a scifi tv advertisement.

Nice idea!

The possibility of this serving as a portal is real, but would require a *lot* of planning and other additions (such as blocks, mobs, items, quests etc.), as well as its own update. Since a new dimension would be such an ordeal, you can count on it not appearing for a while, if at all.
just re-add the stalker in this dimension, it kinda looks like a warden. As for structures, maybe a ruined castle. You could also add skulk phantoms of something.
YES YES YES!!!!!
It would be cool if it was a dimension that is a huge labyrinth, you have to search the labyrinth for loot and try not to get lost (or killed by potential mobs in the labyrinth)
even doing more particles like fireflies concept with butterfly, "ants", etc could help giving some motion between finding mobs.
I agree everytime I play Minecraft alone the whole thing feels like a minor heart attack like I'm going insane.
